definition: to win a championship/to come out top/to take the cup
to clasp/to cup the hands/to hold up with both hands/to offer (esp. in cupped hands)/to praise/to flatter
variant of 杯[bei1]/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup
cup/trophy cup/classifier for certain containers of liquids: glass, cup

sentences.english: You know, John Terry slips in the penalty shoot-out last year and Manchester United win the final.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，特里去年罚点球时摔倒让曼联捧杯。

sentences.english: Then came the triumph at EURO 2008.
sentences.chinese: 然后，西班牙在2008年欧洲杯上捧杯。

sentences.english: They had won four European Cups and quite a few league titles.
sentences.chinese: 他们已四次捧杯欧冠并多次称霸英超。

sentences.english: If we win this (cup), it can only be better for us.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们捧杯，当然最好不过。

definition: to defend the crown (in sports championship)
to win the top award/to come first in the examination rankings
to seize the crown/fig. to win a championship/to win gold medal
